title: [BUG] mlflow-skinny not recognized as mlflow requirement when saving model

labels.name: has-closing-pr
labels.description: This issue has a closing PR

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

mlflow-skinny==1.27.0

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10 Enterprise
- **Python version**:  3.9.14
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: 


### Describe the problem

When saving a model and passing a pip_requirements list with mlflow-skinny but not mlflow, the resulting requirements.txt has a first line with a mlflow (without version). An example illustrates this better. 

When running something like the code below:
```python
packages = ["mlflow-skinny==1.27.0", "other-package==1.0.0"]
mlflow.statsmodels.log_model(
        model,
        "model",
        conda_env=None,
        signature=model_signature,
        pip_requirements=packages,
    )
```

The saved requirements.txt will have the following contents:

```
mlflow
mlflow-skinny==1.27.0
other-package==1.0.0
```

This is undesired when the original environment does not have mlflow, but only mlflow-skinny for example.

I was able to track down the issue to the function [mlflow.utils.environment._contains_mlflow_requirement](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/2e4bb67d0eb9e25b4de480bee2301274ebc96882/mlflow/utils/environment.py#L441). 

This function will return False for mlflow-skinny, which triggers the code below ([from here](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/2e4bb67d0eb9e25b4de480bee2301274ebc96882/mlflow/utils/environment.py#L464)):

```python
    if not _contains_mlflow_requirement(pip_reqs):
        pip_reqs.insert(0, "mlflow")
```


### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

In my case I'm using the statsmodels API, but it doesn't really matter since it's calling the code below.

```python
import mlflow

default_pip_reqs = ["mlflow-skinny==1.27.0", "other-package==1.0.0"]

_, pip_reqs, _ = mlflow.utils.environment._process_pip_requirements(default_pip_reqs)
print(pip_reqs)
```

This prints:
```
['mlflow', 'mlflow-skinny==1.27.0', 'other-package==1.0.0']
```

### Stack trace

No errors in this case, so not sure what to print here. This is the output from the code above.

```python
['mlflow', 'mlflow-skinny==1.27.0', 'other-package==1.0.0']
```

### Other info / logs

_No response_

- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations

- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
